page.title: 13TONMAWR - THE ENVIRONMENT
page.content: 1. In this high land water is in abundance and with it, water dwelling creatures: frogs, newts, fresh water animals of all kinds. Much of the water is an unpleasant brown in colour because it contains iron oxide -called {vitrol}by local people- which washes out of the old mine levels. It seems to have relatively little effect on the life in the water : I have seen tadpoles hatching happily in thick vitrol. 2. Pasture: heavily grazed by sheep, the pasture contains little of interest except fungi, now and again. The local people talk of a halucogenic mushroom growing in the area{Magic {Mushrooms}which is said to be used by teenagers
